raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "Proliferation of surfactant-secreting cells", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "After alveolar injury, regeneration of the alveolar lining primarily involves the proliferation of type II pneumocytes, which are surfactant-secreting cells. These cells not only restore surfactant production but also serve as progenitors for type I pneumocytes, helping re-establish the alveolar epithelium. The other options do not play a primary role in alveolar regeneration."}
